bullets.text: U.S. January payrolls +130k; unemployment ~4.3%, signaling continued but moderating labor-market strength.
Stronger jobs data pushed 10-year Treasury yields higher, reinforcing markets’ sensitivity to labor-driven inflation and Fed timing.
Tariff revenue reportedly up over 300% as Supreme Court decision looms, raising stakes for prices, trade policy durability, and budget effects.
House vote to override Trump’s Canada tariffs highlights intra-party trade splits and potential uncertainty for North American supply chains.
El Paso airspace shutdown tied to anti-drone activity/testing underscores escalating drone threats and regulatory gaps for counter-drone tech in civilian airspace.
Trump order for Pentagon to buy electricity from coal plants signals policy support for coal demand and potential conflict with decarbonization and procurement cost goals.
Cisco shares fell on weaker outlook despite beats, reflecting investor focus on forward guidance amid AI-driven networking competition.
Japan’s Nikkei hit new highs post-election, but commentary warns the rally may be fragile—sensitive to yen moves and AI-linked earnings expectations.
Bill Ackman disclosed a Meta stake, arguing valuation is deeply discounted—boosting focus on Big Tech cash flows and AI monetization narratives.
OpenAI disbanded its mission-alignment team, intensifying concerns about governance and safety prioritization as frontier AI deployment accelerates.
Microsoft warns hackers are exploiting critical Windows/Office zero-days, elevating cyber risk for enterprises and potentially increasing security spend and downtime exposure.
Scientists built living blood vessels on a chip that behave like real tissue, advancing drug testing and disease modeling with potential to reduce animal studies.
